thread.title: Sun Belt honors Lamb, Law with awards
thread.title_full: Sun Belt honors Lamb, Law with awards

author: sports@wataugademocrat.com(Steve Behr)
title: Sun Belt honors Lamb, Law with awards
text:
by Steve Behr 
NEW ORLEANS — Appalachian State University quarterback Taylor Lamb (Calhoun, Ga./Calhoun) and inside linebacker John Law (Atlanta, Ga./Grady) were named the Sun Belt Conference Offensive and Defensive Student-Athletes of the Week, respectively, on Monday in honor of their performances in the Mountaineers’ 49-0 rout at Old Dominion last Saturday. 
Lamb was nearly flawless while playing in a steady rain at ODU. Despite being lifted from the game before the end of the third quarter, he completed 11-of-15 passes for 187 yards and a career-high four touchdowns (53, 41, 24 and one yards). He compiled an incredible 266.05 pass-efficiency rating, which is the fifth-best single-game passer rating in the nation this season and shattered his previous career high of 206.93, set in Appalachian’s season opening victory over Howard. 
The sophomore was especially effective in App State’s 28-point second quarter, when he went 5-of-7 for 136 yards and three touchdowns to help stake the Mountaineers to a commanding 35-0 halftime lead. 
Lamb was named Sun Belt Student-Athlete of the Week for the second time in his career. 
He also earned the award for his performance in last season’s 31-29 win over UL Monroe. 
Law led Appalachian State to its second shutout of the young season with a team-high seven tackles (including one for loss) and an interception during Saturday’s blowout in Norfolk. 
His biggest play of the afternoon came when he recorded his second interception of the season to spark a Mountaineer touchdown drive early in the third quarter. 
Led by the junior, Appalachian limited Old Dominion to just 175 total yards, barely half of its 340.3-yard average coming into the contest. ODU managed only 42 rushing yards, including just 22 by Ray Lawry, who entered the game as the nation’s No. 13 rusher with a 151-yard average. 
Law also earned the second weekly Sun Belt award of his career. He was previously honored for his showing in last season’s finale against Idaho.
